intro: Canthium chapmanii, commonly known as Chapman's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its production of a milky latex sap. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has alternate, simple, ovate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. The plant is often found in wetlands and is adapted to thrive in saturated soil conditions.
